title: In Situ TEM Investigation of Graphitization Mechanism on Nickel Catalyst
content: The graphitization mechanism with Ni, which is one of the most important catalysts for graphitization, involves the precipitation of carbon from the Ni. There are two possible precipitation pathways: through the C solubility gradient by cooling, and through the segregation from the intermediate carbide phase [1-5]. In this study, through in situ heating transmission electron microscopy (TEM), we present the graphitization mechanism of stacked Ni and amorphous carbon (a-C) film.
